intro: Tithymalus matthiolii, commonly known as the Italian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically produces yellow to orange flowers with dark centers, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Tithymalus matthiolii is often used in rock gardens and as a border plant due to its ornamental value and hardiness. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
